intro: Sarcodactilis, commonly known as the "spear-tongue" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiny bracts that resemble tiny spears, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in a radiate pattern, and are pollinated by insects. Sarcodactilis species are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and hardy nature.
